page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable extensions to existing encroachments

Fig 19 Allowable extensions of existing walls that encroach into required yards (on ground floor only)

A Extension of existing side yard
encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the
required interior side yard setback but is at
least 5'-0" from the property line, may be
extended at the same setback, in one
direction only, at the ground floor only, for a
distance equal to the length of the existing
wall or 20' whichever is less.
Note: In the example below, two existing
walls are encroaching--only one of them
may be extended.

B Extension of existing front yard
encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the
required front yard setback but is at least
14'-0" from the property line, may be
extended at the same setback, in one
direction only, at the ground floor only, with
both of the following provisions:
1) the length of the extension is no greater
than that of the existing encroaching wall,
2) the combined length is no greater than
one-half the maximum width of the house.

C Extension of existing street-side
yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the
required street side yard setback but is at
least 10'-0" from the property line, may be
extended at the same setback, in one
direction only, at the ground floor only, for a
distance equal to the length of the existing
wall or 20' whichever is less.

Note:
• Encroaching walls that
don't meet the minimim
setback given for each
case i.e., 5', 14, and 10',
may not be extended nor
may they may not be
stepped back and then
extended.
• Multiple protrusions are
not permitted; addition
must be contiguous with
existing protrusion.
• Only for structures that
were legally constructed,
without a variance or an
home-improvement
exception (HIE).
• Only once in the life of the
structure.
• Requires retention of the
non- complying wall.
• Exceptions apply to special
setbacks as well.

Key

Lot line
Required setback:
Buildable area
Sidewalk
Existing house
Addition

25

visual_elements.description: A three-part diagram illustrating different types of allowable extensions to existing encroachments. Each part shows a top-down view of a property with a house, setbacks, and an addition. The diagrams are labeled A, B, and C, corresponding to the text sections.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: Diagram A: Shows an 'Existing house' (dark grey) with an 'Addition' (black) extending into the 'Interior-side yard'. The 'Required setback' (dashed line) is indicated. Arrows point from 'Interior-side yard' to the encroaching wall. A note below the diagram states 'Only one of the two encroaching walls may be extended'. Dimensions '15' min.' are shown for the setback.

Diagram B: Shows an 'Existing house' (dark grey) with an 'Addition' (black) extending into the 'Front yard'. The 'Required setback' (dashed line) is indicated. Dimensions '14' min.' are shown for the setback. Text labels 'Length of existing encroaching wall max.' and 'Half the width of the building max.' are shown with corresponding arrows indicating the maximum allowable extension length.

Diagram C: Shows an 'Existing house' (dark grey) with an 'Addition' (black) extending into the 'Street-side yard'. The 'Required setback' (dashed line) is indicated. Dimensions '10' min.' are shown for the setback. The 'Street-side yard' is labeled along the side of the property.

A key explaining the symbols used in the diagrams:
- Solid line: Lot line
- Dashed line: Required setback
- Light grey shaded area with dashed border: Buildable area
- Patterned area (horizontal lines): Sidewalk
- Dark grey solid fill: Existing house
- Black solid fill: Addition

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum interior side yard setback for extension
Minimum front yard setback for extension
Maximum extension length (front yard) relative to existing wall
technical_specifications.value: no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum combined extension length (front yard) relative to house width
technical_specifications.value: one-half the maximum width of the house

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum street-side yard setback for extension

subheadings: A Extension of existing side yard encroachment
B Extension of existing front yard encroachment
C Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment

additional_notes: The page number '25' is located at the bottom right corner.

The overall layout is clean and well-organized, with a main heading, a figure caption, three main sections (A, B, C) describing different types of extensions, a general 'Note' section, and a 'Key' for the diagrams.
The diagrams are clearly labeled and illustrate the concepts described in the text.
The text '15' min.' in diagram A appears to be a typo and should likely be '5' min.' based on the text description in section A.
